definition: to move as in a dance/to wave (some implement)/to flourish/(of eyes, hands etc) to dance/to flutter
(of sth) to move/to set in movement/to displace/to touch/to make use of/to stir (emotions)/to alter/abbr. for 動詞|动词[dong4 ci2], verb

sentences.english: The snake, however, continued to 'dance' slowly .
sentences.chinese: 然而那蛇却还是缓慢的“舞动”着。

sentences.english: I've seen a friend killed by his best friend.
sentences.chinese: 我见过了在风中舞动的柳叶。

sentences.english: Firelight shadows began to shimmer and dance around the room.
sentences.chinese: 火光的影子开始在屋里跳跃舞动。

sentences.english: At the learning stage, your child will be able to follow the rhythm while learning to sing and dance.
sentences.chinese: 在牙牙学语的阶段，更能跟著音乐的节奏哼唱舞动。

sentences.english: Look at the Red, you Jingsi Music, dancing cool breeze.
sentences.chinese: 看红尘，你是青丝飘飘，舞动清风。

sentences.english: The white sails billow with the breezes they catch.
sentences.chinese: 一张张白帆随着微风舞动。

sentences.english: Students follow an instructor’s movements in a Bollywood dance class.
sentences.chinese: 在宝莱坞舞蹈班上，学生们跟着老师一起舞动。

sentences.english: "Waves Beijing" is India of the side China.
sentences.chinese: “舞动的北京”是一方中国之印。

sentences.english: Oh, you and I dancing slow, and we got nowhere to go.
sentences.chinese: 哦，你和我缓慢的舞动着，我们走投无路。
“舞动的北京”是一方中国之印。

sentences.english: Percussion, singing, dancing, composes to the peaceful melody of mountains and seas.
sentences.chinese: 击乐，歌唱，舞动，融合出山海翻腾的和平乐章。

sentences.english: It is elegant, dancing, wind, people dance chord.
sentences.chinese: 它轻盈飘逸，姿态婆娑，随风舞动，勾人心弦。

sentences.english: The flecks did float and dance.
Dance when you go to give her the send-off this night.
sentences.chinese: 当你今天夜里欢送她的时候，舞动。

sentences.english: To the pounding beat of the drums and cymbals, the dragon began to dance.
sentences.chinese: 锣鼓不住地响着，龙灯开始舞动了。

sentences.english: Now she returns to pumping the device to the beat of a Japanese pop song.
sentences.chinese: 现在，她返回打开设备跟着日本流行歌曲的节拍舞动。

definition: to flutter/to dance in the breeze
to fly up/to dance in the air (of snowflakes, flower petals etc)
to shake/to fling one's arm/to lash/to swing
to sway gently (as in the wind)/(of a flame) to flicker
(of a breeze) to make (hair, leaves, clothing etc) sway gently/to ruffle
to sprinkle/to shed (tears, blood etc)/fig. free, unconstrained/to write in a free style
to sway/to swing/to move back and forth/to oscillate
